text: during the high priesthood of Annas (also Caiaphas),Annas was the real high priest, which office was for life. But in an effort to diminish the political influence of the high priest (presumably) the Roman government obliged the Jews to name a different high priest each year, and the governor dealt with him—so that particular year it was Caiaphas. Notice how Luke emphasizes historicity. the word of God came uponThat's what the Text says, ‘upon’ not ‘to’; I take it that that Word compelled him to action. John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
